ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would only recommend it as an introductory vision of latin american literature.
I definitely would recommend the course to other students, because it gives a very clear and comprehensive view of one of the most important periods of Latin American literature.
Absolutely would recommend. Modernismo is such an important part of latin american literature and this course really highlights why that is and in what ways.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It allowed me to define rigorously the "Modernismo". Reading the journalistic chronicles helped me realize that the "modernista" aesthetic was not exclusive of the poetry and novel.

Since this is my main area of interest, my work on Lugones was extremely interesting and exciting for me. It really opened up a whole new level of appreciation for his work and allowed me to work with his experimental theater, which I hope to continue to focus on and broaden my work in in the future.
